result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Bannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J. Bannon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew J. Bannon was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Ct. 3 Dismissed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J. Bannon in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 Dismissed but read in.  Ct. 3 Dismissed.  Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  $443.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  1 day jail credit.  Posted bond to be applied towards costs, remaining balance to be returned.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by ADA Genda

Defendant Matthew J. Bannon in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Atty Lawton has recently been appointed.   Bond remains.  New return date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Disposal of CIB cards re: felony bail jumping and possess drug paraphernalia - information recorded
standard felony conditions, not possess/consume any alcohol or any controlled substances w/out valid prescription

Defendant Matthew J. Bannon in court, in custody by video with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $750.00 cash bail, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume alcohol or any controlled substances w/out valid prescription, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
